title: Magnus Volk
text: Magnus Volk was the inventor of the daddy long legs. In this clip he will tell you about his life.

title: About the Daddy Long Legs
text: Magnus Volk tells you about the daddy long legs

title: About the Daddy Long Legs
text: Magnus Volk tells you about the daddy long legs

title: About the Daddy Long Legs
section: History of the daddy long legs
text:
History of the daddy long legs
Magnus Volk tells you about the history of the daddy long legs

title: About the Daddy Long Legs
text:
How did it work
Sir Fliberdy Walshire who has a PhD in engineering and is a graduate from Lancaster University tells you about how the daddy long legs worked.

title: The Daddy long legs
text: The daddy long legs was part train, part boat, and part car. I think it is the craziest invention ever. This website is about the weird and wonderful daddy long legs

title: The Daddy long legs
text: The daddy long legs was part train, part boat, and part car. I think it is the craziest invention ever. This website is about the weird and wonderful daddy long legs

title: Credits
text:
This website was created by Zachary Field and his Dad. You can view the code at https://github.com/profandyfield/volks_website
Zachary did the following:

Researched all the information on the DLL
Found images
Wrote all of the scripts for the videos
Wrote all of the text on the website
Chose the costumes

Zacharyâ€™s dad did the following:

Set up the skeleton website using quarto a markdown-based system for writing html (and therefore easy for kids to learn)
Filmed the videos
Wrote this page

Team effort:

Editing the videos: Dad showed Zachary what to do using Camtasia for the first video, then Zachary did the other videos (with some verbal prompts)
Editing the website: Dad showed Zachary some basic Markdown, and helped him to use it to change the website menues, add links, insert the videos. Zachary pretended to be interested in Github and netlify)

title: Fish-eye view
text: A fish explains why the daddy long legs was not a happy sight for everyone.
